bullet_points: Read the train and test CSV files from the specified file paths.
Display the first few rows of each DataFrame to confirm successful loading.
Print the shape and column names of both DataFrames.
Check for data consistency between train and test sets: compare column names, data types, and value ranges for each feature.
Save the loaded DataFrames for further analysis.

bullet_points: Generate summary statistics (mean, std, min, max, etc.) for numeric columns.
Show value counts for categorical columns.
Check for missing values and data types.
Visualize distributions of key features (e.g., age, balance, duration).
Summarize the target variable distribution.
Perform correlation analysis between features and the target variable (including both numeric and encoded categorical features).
Analyze the relationship between campaign-related features (duration, campaign, pdays, previous, poutcome) and the target variable.
Examine temporal patterns in the data using the month feature to identify any seasonality in customer responses.
Document any data transformations or cleaning steps performed during EDA.

bullet_points: Handle categorical variables (e.g., encoding).
Normalize numeric features as appropriate.
Address any class imbalance in the target variable (e.g., via resampling or class weights).
Save the cleaned/processed DataFrames as pickle or CSV files for easy reuse.
Provide example code snippets for loading these DataFrames in future analyses.
Document all data transformations performed to ensure reproducibility.

bullet_points: Explain how to load the saved DataFrames in Python.
Describe each feature in detail, including its type, possible values, and banking domain context.
Discuss how each feature might influence term deposit subscriptions, referencing EDA findings (including campaign and temporal effects).
Provide recommendations on feature selection or feature engineering based on EDA results.
Discuss best practices for using the DataFrame in further analyses.
Highlight any important findings or considerations from the EDA.
